H0.text: Energy is required to move or change matter from one state to another.

H1.text: Food is required to move or change matter from one state to another.

H2.text: Gravity is required to move or change matter from one state to another.

H3.text: Evolution is required to move or change matter from one state to another.

A4.text: Energy can be transferred between systems in a variety of ways. Examples include the transmission of electromagnetic energy via photons, physical collisions which transfer kinetic energy, tidal interactions, and the conductive transfer of thermal energy.

A5.text: Energy is the quantitative property that is transferred to a body or to a physical system, recognizable in the performance of work and in the form of heat and light.
